item.title: 'Modern Romance' By Aziz Ansari - Book Notes
item.description: Captures “People will go as far as they have to to find a mate, but no farther.” For the young people who got married in the 1950s, getting married was the first step in adulthood. After high school or college, you got married and you left the house. For today’s folks, marriage is usually one of the later stages in adulthood. Now most young people spend their twenties and thirties in another stage of life, where they go to university, start a career, and experience being an adult outside of their parents’ home before marriage.
